intro: Metastelma exasperatum, commonly known as the spiny leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees in tropical regions. It has small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine, spiny hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. Its parasitic nature allows it to draw water and nutrients from its host, while also contributing to the ecosystem by providing food for wildlife. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays a role in both ecological interactions and botanical study.
